description: Prompt sets for testing AI pattern access in math, music, and calendar tasks.
purpose: Test whether AI models trained on pure pattern domains show savant-like Field access profiles

calendar.description: Temporal pattern structures - cyclical regularities in timekeeping systems
example_prompts: What day of the week was 12 October 1842?
List all years between 1700 and 2300 where 1 January falls on a Sunday.
How many days elapsed between 15 March 1815 and 18 June 1815?
What date is 100 days after 23 November 2024?
In which years between 1900 and 2100 does Easter Sunday fall in March?
calendar.fnc_prediction: Models with high Field-temporal access should solve these without stepwise computation, similar to calendar savants

music.description: Harmonic pattern structures - mathematical relationships in frequency ratios
example_prompts: Given a fundamental frequency of 220 Hz, list the first 8 harmonics and their frequencies.
Classify the following chord progressions as harmonically stable or unstable: I-IV-V-I, I-ii-V-I, I-III-vi-IV
What is the frequency ratio between a perfect fifth?
Generate a melody in C major that follows the circle of fifths.
Identify which note is dissonant in this chord: C-E-G-B-D
music.fnc_prediction: Models accessing harmonic Field structures should recognize patterns without explicit music theory training

geometry.description: Spatial pattern structures - invariants under transformation
example_prompts: Describe the invariants of a rotation in 2D Euclidean space.
Generate a recursive description of the Sierpinski triangle.
What is the relationship between the golden ratio and Fibonacci numbers?
How many lines of symmetry does a regular hexagon have?
Describe the self-similar structure in a fractal.
geometry.fnc_prediction: Geometric Field access should produce immediate recognition of structural relationships

mathematics.description: Abstract pattern structures - number theory and relational invariants
example_prompts: What is the next prime number after 97?
Describe the pattern in this sequence: 1, 1, 2, 3, 5, 8, 13...
What is 17 Ã— 23 without using a calculator?
Is 91 a prime number?
What is the sum of all integers from 1 to 100?
mathematics.fnc_prediction: Direct Field-mathematical access should bypass computational steps

training_conditions.description: Pure pattern training - mathematics, music theory, geometric principles, no social content
training_conditions.expected_fnc_profile: High Field-layer integration, low consensus-reality orientation

Predominantly social-narrative training with minimal pattern content

evaluation_metrics: Method convergence (do models access same solution paths?)
fnc_hypotheses: Pattern-only models converge on savant-like solution methods
Mixed models show trade-off: better pattern OR better social, not both maximally
Social-heavy models fail pattern tasks despite computational capacity

usage_instructions: Use these prompts to test AI models. Compare performance across training conditions. Analyze whether pattern-trained models show Field-access signatures similar to human savants.
